Articles.Content:
I tried exploring the forums extensively, but could not find a specific answer to my question. This thread essentially had the same question as me but wasn't really ever answered:

My MPL has had the exact same amount of data for quite some time now, and even when I transmit the science that has been generated, the amount of data still in the MPL remains constant (464.552 data). Is this a bug? Shouldn't it use the data, not just need to be filled up one time, and remain that way forever? This just doesn't make a lot of sense to me; it seems far too OP for an already fairly OP item.

My second question was, if my lab has ~460 data, what is the easiest way to max it out to 500 data? I have a couple of experiments on board I could use as data, but they are both 125 or 150 data each, and it won't allow me to add them to the lab because of this. Is there no way to just add part of the data from that experiment? Is my only option to find an experiment that's worth ~40 data?

Thanks guys!

 

Edited March 11, 2016 by KocLobster

9 minutes ago, KocLobster said:

My MPL has had the exact same amount of data for quite some time now, and even when I transmit the science that has been generated, the amount of data still in the MPL remains constant (464.552 data). Is this a bug? Shouldn't it use the data, not just need to be filled up one time, and remain that way forever? This just doesn't make a lot of sense to me; it seems far too OP for an already fairly OP item.

Do you have it researching?

  • If it's researching:  you should see data gradually dropping while science increases.  One data is consumed for every five science generated.
  • If it's not researching:  nothing happens

Are you saying that you have a science lab that's generating science while absolutely no data is consumed?

11 minutes ago, KocLobster said:

My second question was, if my lab has ~460 data, what is the easiest way to max it out to 500 data? I have a couple of experiments on board I could use as data, but they are both 125 or 150 data each, and it won't allow me to add them to the lab because of this.

Correct.

13 minutes ago, KocLobster said:

Is there no way to just add part of the data from that experiment?

Nope.

13 minutes ago, KocLobster said:

Is my only option to find an experiment that's worth ~40 data?

Yup.

See, not everything in life has to be complicated.

What should happen is the data should go down over time and the science should go up. When you get to 500 science, transmit it and it goes back to zero. Data remains as it was at this stage. If you have experiments which are small enough to fit into the space between current data and 500, you should be able to add it. There is nothing you can do to make a 125 science experiment fit into a 40 data space. Except wait until the space gets bigger.

If your data space is not getting bigger (data number getting smaller) then you may have a bug. I've not heard of one. Or perhaps, just thinking "out loud" here, there is something strange about your scientists. Do you have two? Are they high enough in experience? Are they in the science lab? Some other questions about scientists that I will think of as soon as I hit submit...

2 hours ago, Snark said:

Do you have it researching?

  • If it's researching:  you should see data gradually dropping while science increases.  One data is consumed for every five science generated.
  • If it's not researching:  nothing happens

Are you saying that you have a science lab that's generating science while absolutely no data is consumed?

Yes that is exactly what I am saying. My MPL is always researching, and it is never consuming data, not even a tiny fraction that's barely noticeable. Literally consumes no data whatsoever. Thanks for your answers, they were quite easy to understand

2 hours ago, Phil deCube said:

What should happen is the data should go down over time and the science should go up. When you get to 500 science, transmit it and it goes back to zero. Data remains as it was at this stage. If you have experiments which are small enough to fit into the space between current data and 500, you should be able to add it. There is nothing you can do to make a 125 science experiment fit into a 40 data space. Except wait until the space gets bigger.

If your data space is not getting bigger (data number getting smaller) then you may have a bug. I've not heard of one. Or perhaps, just thinking "out loud" here, there is something strange about your scientists. Do you have two? Are they high enough in experience? Are they in the science lab? Some other questions about scientists that I will think of as soon as I hit submit...

Yeah so it must be a bug of some kind because my data is not being consumed at all when research is taking place and producing science. I've been stuck at 464.552 data for quite some time now. This seems completely backwards, I don't understand how this isn't a bug. Yes, two scientists, both in the lab. They are both just 1 star scientists.

18 minutes ago, KocLobster said:

Yes, two scientists, both in the lab. They are both just 1 star scientists.

The more stars the quicker they will do their job, but it still sounds like a bug to me. Do you have mods installed? It could be one of them?
And easy test is to save your game and then time warp 1 year in the future.  Empty the lab warp again do this 5-6 times if it is still producing science it is definitely bugged

I think I must of made a mistake, sorry guys. I am human! I don't know what changed, but it appears to be consuming data finally. It WASNT before, this I swear. But for whatever reason, I can see it very slowly consuming data again. I didn't uninstall any mods, though some have been turned off recently. Maybe it was just human error? I honestly don't know. Sorry for wasting your time.
I am seen plenty of things that magically fix them selves don't worry about it.
